PROWLED.Definition: moving around in search for news

MUMBLES.Definition: too quiet or not clear enough words

FOREHEAD.Definition: the part of the face above the eyes and below the hair

EXPENDITURE.Definition: the action of spending money or funds

CONSTITUTIONALITY.Definition: the quality of being in accordance with the constitution (system of laws and rules)

PATRIOT.Definition: a person who loves his country

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: claims or statements, made without proof, that he had done something wrong

CREDENTIALS.Definition: qualities, achievements that showed he was anti-communist

COURIER.Definition: a person who took messages from one person to another

SPY RING.Definition: a network or group of spies working together

TESTIFYING UNDER OATH.Definition: giving information after having promised that he would speak the truth

SWORE.Definition: formally promised that it was true

SUBLET.Definition: allowed him to rent the apartment that he was renting from someone else

BIRDWATCHERS.Definition: people who liked to watch birds in their environment as a hobby

THE GRAND SCHEME OF THINGS.Definition: considering everything, taking everything into account

SLANDER.Definition: the crime of making a false public statement about him

DEPOSITION.Definition: formal written statement used in court

UNDEVELOPED.Definition: darker than it should have been because of not having been fully processed

GRAND JURY.Definition: a group of citizens who would decide if there was enough information to believe that a crime had been committed to begin a trial

PERJURY.Definition: the crime of telling lies in court

HUNG JURY.Definition: a jury that cannot decide whether the accused is innocent or guilty

TESTIMONY.Definition: a formal statement in a court of law

CONVICTED.Definition: decided that he was or declared guilty

FALL FROM GRACE.Definition: loss of favour or of a position of power and honour

HAD ALL BUT DECIDED.Definition: had decided almost completely or conclusively

COMMUNIST SYMPATHIES.Definition: friendly or supportive feelings towards communists

INFILTRATION.Definition: the action of gaining access to secret information

HEADLINE COPY.Definition: title of an article, the first thing a reader sees

BACK-PAGE FILLER.Definition: less important news found on the back part of a newspaper

COMMUNIST SYMPATHISER.Definition: someone who had friendly or supportive feelings towards communists
